Ingredients for an Excellent Ecommerce Web Design

A highly effective and efficient site is the identity of every online business. Functionality and great designs are some important factors that count a lot in an ecommerce site, but there are also some ingredients that are important for a site’s effectiveness.

An ecommerce site is not made up of one component. There are several ingredients necessary to make the site successful in the long term. These ingredients are all vital and must not be missed out while designing or developing an ecommerce website.

Some of the points below are small factors but it will prove to be effective while building an ecommerce web page design:

Usability: The main thing that most people forget is the usability of an ecommerce site. Your site is going to be visited by the customers and if the site is not providing a user friendly mode, then it is definitely going to frustrate the users. If a user finds the site navigation hard to access, they will log out and might access your competitors site. The main function of a site is to answer the questions that users put in. Some of the data that should be easily accessible to the visitors are contact details, procedure for purchase and ordering products or services.
Site Functionality: Website functionality is another important point. The most important issue that relates to functionality are slow loading, long duration of download and page errors.
Search engine optimization: One of the most important factors that relates to ecommerce design is search engine optimization. Optimizing a site is done to make the site noticeable by potential customers. Without this method, an ecommerce web page design will be worthless. Implementing SEO must be the first step that should be taken while designing an ecommerce website.
Browser compatibility: Another important factor is to make the site compatible with all major browsers. People use different browsers and a site should be designed keeping this under consideration. You must always take advantage of the latest browser technologies. The website should also be compatible with the oldest and latest browser versions.

The above factors should not be neglected if you need to have a powerful ecommerce portal.

The best solution yet is to hire an ecommerce web development company. They will be able to provide you with great results. Again, developing or designing an ecommerce site is not a child’s play. It is always better to leave it to the professionals.

You must also, always keep in mind that, a physical grocery shopping basket, is far less functional than an online shopping cart. This article will provide you with some quick tips that you should consider while purchasing a shopping cart for your online business. Some of them are listed below:

The price of the online shopping cart software is important, especially if you are not working with a lot of funds to begin with.

Also, you will want to come up with a list of products you want to sell in addition to how many future products you might want to add to your product line.

The Role of Payment Gateway

Payment gateway is basically a point in a network, or in a service provider, that allows a user to enter other networks and pay for their purchases online via websites.

It is very similar to a Point of Sale in any real world shop. The Point of Sale is a basic terminal that is found at every brick and mortar retail outlet. The payment gateway service is also provided by a number of banking institutions and e-commerce sites as well today.

The main role of the payment gateway is security. It helps to encrypt any crucial and sensitive credit card information, like the credit card number. It also helps to send these details through a secured network from the shopper to the merchant and from the merchant to the payment processor.

The process of linking any e-commerce store with a payment gateway is known as payment gateway integration.

How does the payment gateway work?

1. Once the customer chooses an item for purchase, he or she will submit an order, which will be sent in an encrypted form to the merchants server. This SSL encryption is present to assure the customer that the data that is being transmitted is secure.
2. The same information is then passed on to the gateway.
3. The transaction details will then be passed on to the merchant's bank.
4. The bank in turn, will then send these details to an issuing bank (the bank that has initially issued the credit card to the customer).
5. Once the details are received, the issuing bank will then send the response to the online gateway whether the payment should be accepted or not. If the payment should not be accepted, the reason for non-acceptance will also be sent.
6. This information is then passed on to the gateway, and from there the merchants server.
7. This response will then be sent to the customer in an encrypted form to inform the customer whether his or her order was successful or not.
8. If successful, the issuing bank will then deposit the money in the merchant's account.

Online payment gateways are essential, as without these systems, the payment of products and services that are being purchased online would not be possible. Thus, we can say that the payment gateway helps to augment the use of e-commerce.

Credit Card Fraud – How to Combat it?

While online, anyone who provides his or her credit card number for any reason could be a potential victim of credit card fraud. To combat this, credit card fraud screening has been established. This blog will deal with all the dangers resulting from credit card fraud and the ways to combat it through screening.

Credit card frauds include any of the following:

1. Frauds in the credit card applications, wherein the information that is used to obtain the card is not essentially true.
2. Where the credit card is stolen from the mailbox before it even reaches its intended recipient.
3. Where the card is used by a person who is someone other than who it belongs to.
4. Where the card is first tampered with to be used.
5. Credit card skimming is when the magnetic strip on the card is read first by a pocket device and then any additional items are charged to the card.
6. Credit card takeover is when the fraudster takes the credit card by impersonating the owner of the card and then changing the address of the card.
7. Site spoofing is when the fraudster builds a website that resembles that of the legitimate financial institution and dupes visitors into providing information
8. Phishing is a variety of methods that induces unknowing victims to divulge their credit card information.

In an effort to combat credit card frauds, credit card fraud screening was devised. It is basically a service that is offered by many companies to help Internet merchants prevent credit card frauds. The main goal is ensure that each and every online transaction is safe, secure and legitimate. Many [url=]payment gateway providers[/url] have a variety of screening features.

Important ways to make your eCommerce web site SEO friendly

eCommerce web site development should be done in such a way that it is optimized for all the major search engines. This can be achieved by practicing Search Engine Optimization techniques. If you make your web site SEO friendly, you will undoubtedly rank higher for relevant and common keywords put in by users when they are searching for your site. Only, this has to be done in a proper manner. A look into the following points will give you a full idea on how to go about developing your eCommerce web site:

Use of correct keywords: Always remember to make use of keywords that are relevant and appropriate for your site. Inappropriate keywords will lead visitors away from your site. And make sure to not use them a lot. It will lead to keyword stuffing. The content of your web site should be of good quality. Information which is relevant to your web site will help attract visitors. Also, search engines love information in bulk.

Unique meta tags for each page: The meta tags for any web site include the title of the web page, its description along with the keywords. A good SEO practice always insists on using the the first targeted keyword at the very beginning of the title. The keyword tag would include all the keywords you have used in your web page. The ranking should be in order of relevancy from first to last. The description tag should not be more than 10-15 words describing only the page. It is always advisable to have a separate meta tag for every web page.

Submitting your site to search engines: A good eCommerce web site development practice includes submission of the web site to all the major search engines. This procedure usually takes time because the search engine spiders need to crawl through your web site to get it indexed. All you have to do is to visit a major search engine and fill out the corresponding form.

Submitting your site to directories: This will help linking your web site to all popular and high ranked web sites. Building up a profile with a back link to your web site also helps a lot. You could also try article marketing, which will eventually provide a back link to your web site. Link building can also be tried. Though this requires patience, it brings in favorable results.

One important thing to remember is that each search engine uses a different algorithm while conducting its search. These algorithms are not public and to maintain the secrecy, are always altered by the companies. Incorporating these useful tips in your eCommerce web site development strategy may help you achieve better Search Engine Optimization and gradually, higher ranks.

Importance of a Web Design Layout

When planning the initial design of your website, it is very important to consider your web design layout. So, you have your business plan in place and you have identified the best marketing niche for your business. Your marketing strategies are raring to go. Your hosting service and domain name are all in place. The only thing missing is a web design layout. And although it seems like a good move to hire the services of a good web design company, it is very important to first put in a little effort before you go ahead and hire a professional.

The simple fact is that nobody else knows the workings of your business like you do. You are the only one who knows what appearance your site should have. And although a good designer can bring forth the visual elements, only you will know what really appeals to your niche audience. What's more, you may also know all the marketing tricks that can help you rank high in the search engines. These factors are not what your designer would give to you. What a designer can do is provide you with a pretty page to attract more visitors. And this is why it is very important for you to take active interest in the workings of your website.

Start with your page composition. Your home page should ideally be inviting and still fulfill your sales objectives. Once your visitor clicks on your page and visits the home page, you should make sure that they can see what your sales offerings are immediately, without being required to scroll down. A good web design layout will make your sales points immediately visible to the visitor. Your value propositions should be found easily. So start by designing a layout in your mind. How and where you place your ads is another very important component. Your ads should clearly display what you want your visitors to see.

You must also think of the type of software that may affect your search engine rankings. Flash videos and slide shows are problematic. The search engine spiders cannot read Flash, thus doing absolutely nothing for your rankings. Consider the different kinds of browsers. When you talk to a web designer, ask them what kinds of problems are associated with different browsers. Most people tend to use Internet Explorer. However, Opera and Firefox are very close contenders as well. Each of these browsers would display your website differently. So, if your website can only accommodate Internet Explorer, then you are going to lose out on all the customers who use Firefox and Opera.

So, make sure you think about the web design before you avail the services of a web designer, so as to avoid encountering such problems.
